byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and MATT APUZZO

abstract: Pentagon inspector general investigates allegations that United States Central Command officials have skewed intelligence assessments of campaign in Iraq against Islamic State to give more optimistic picture of conflict; unusual move raises concerns about war and may reveal reason for wide variations in reports on progress.
lead_paragraph: The inspector general is looking into a claim that military officials reworked assessments about the U.S.-led campaign in Iraq against ISIS to be more optimistic, according to several officials.

headline.main: Inquiry Weighs Whether ISIS Analysis Was Distorted
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Weighs If ISIS Analysis Was Distorted

snippet: The inspector general is looking into a claim that military officials reworked assessments about the U.S.-led campaign in Iraq against ISIS to be more optimistic, according to several officials.
